ANU.name: Ranald Clouston
expertise: Category Theory K Theory Homological Algebra
interest: I am interested in the application of logic, algebra and category theory  to computer science. In particular, I have looked at the ubiquitous  computer science notion of names that may be bound, and co-created Nominal Equational Logic for formalisms definable via equations modulated by side conditions regarding the 'freshness' of names.  I am currently interested in generalising this logic to deal with the  complex and subtle binding structure that may occur in realistic  computing applications.
ANU.biography: I obtained my PhD at the University of Cambridge. Prior to  that I studied up to Masters level at Victoria University of Wellington.

publication.title: Nominal Lawvere Theories

publication.title: Nominal Equational Logic
